fields.description:
Recently I upgraded to Confluence 2.3.3 and found a bunch of my pages using the jiraissues macro failed. I figured out that this was being caused by some of the jiraissues macros having |max=100} on the end. I guess max is not an allowed property. Perhaps a property check was added in 2.3 that was not there before. This results in the following error in the log:

2007-03-09 17:50:01,709 ERROR [http-80-Processor15] [confluence.util.velocity.VelocityUtils] getRenderedTemplate Error occurred rendering template: templates/extra/jira/jiraissues-max=150.vm
org.apache.velocity.exception.ResourceNotFoundException: Unable to find resource 'templates/extra/jira/jiraissues-max=150.vm'
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.ResourceManagerImpl.loadResource(ResourceManagerImpl.java:501)


Clearly the illegal property is being appended to the macro name for some reason resulting in a search for a non existent Velocity file.
fields.summary: jiraissues macro will append invalid attributes to file velocity name, resulting in the macro failing
Macro or plugin to add Google gadgets to Confluence pages

fields.description:
I am filing this as a bug as the information provided by the exceptions are next to useless from a system administration perspective. This is an extension of CONF-7878 as there are other areas where context being added would be very useful - e.g. in indexing exceptions, which only sometimes tell me which file, and never tell me the CEO id. Here is an example where I haven't got either:

2007-03-09 12:31:17,057 ERROR [com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ConfluenceMultiThreadedIndexer: 2] [bonnie.search.extractor.MsPowerpointContentExtractor] processPOIFSReaderEvent Looks like an invalid size? 2344066126

This one has the file name, but I have no idea where to start looking for it:

2007-03-09 14:20:50,293 ERROR [com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ConfluenceMultiThreadedIndexer: 9] [bonnie.search.extractor.BaseAttachmentContentExtractor] addFields Error indexing attachment (richtlijnen-licht-letsel.pdf): Error getting content of PDF document

I get this following error a lot too, which is incredibly unuseful - it's only by chance that I've figured out that it's indexing related to POI processed files:

[WARNING] Unknown Ptg 3d (61)
fields.summary: Missing context on indexing exceptions / errors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8017].
  {panel}

Here's the basic idea.  No matter how fast Confluence becomes working on the local machine is always going to be faster.  So having something like TiddlyWiki is very useful.  However, the problem immediately becomes how to synchronize work done in Tiddlywiki across multiple machines.

What would be really cool is to come up with a plugin/modified Tiddlywiki, whatever it takes to make it so that you could use Tiddlywiki locally and have it automatically save up to a configured Confluence wiki.  Or even better, make a TiddlyWiki clone that uses Confluence's markup language.

Think of it sort of like "Confluence-Lite" or something.  Heck, this could even be a nice way to deal with disconnected Confluence wiki content management.

Anyway, just an idea as I stumbled around looking for a nice server side solution for Tiddlywiki to sync it up on multiple machines.
fields.summary: Plugin, macro or feature to support integration with TiddlyWiki (or a Confluence equivalent of Tiddlywiki)

fields.description: ...and mention that links won't break

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8013].
  {panel}

We have hundreds of users, which are members of hundreds of LDAP groups, and we have several dozen spaces that are managed by various space admins.

When LDAP changes groups around, or when space admins alter permissions, our users often lose their ability to access pages.

REQUEST: (optionally) send the site administrator a notification when a space administrator adds/removes/changes the space permissions AND/OR allow admin to see all permission changes by space in reverse chronological order.

see also: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8012
fields.summary: Site admins are not notified when space admins add users, especially those who are not permitted on the site

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8012].
  {panel}

We have hundreds of users, which are members of hundreds of LDAP groups, and we have several dozen spaces that are managed by various space admins.

When LDAP changes groups around, or when space admins alter permissions, our users often lose their ability to access pages.

if there was an indication, at the space level on the permissions screen, for the space administrator, that the person or group that the admin has just added has one or more members that would NOT be able to access the space because they were not permitted via the SITE permissions, then the space admin could contact the site admin immediately and solve the problem without the users having to get a 'not permitted' error.

REQUEST: Put a red-flag indicator beside ant group or individual, on the space permission tab, which indicates one or more members are not also listed on the site permissions.
fields.summary: Site and Space permissions are difficult to keep syncrhonized in large or complex environments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8011].
  {panel}

When you click on a label, it takes you to a nice interface that shows you all of the content where that label is used.  However, you have to infer by the content what the intention / use of the label is for.  Does 'conf' mean confluence or configuration or something else entirely? Is it a list of articles that are about confluence? refer to confluence? articles that should be moved to the confluence space, or need to be updated when confluence is change? Probably all of the above.

It would be excellent to have a 'wiki section at the top of the LABELS tab for a space, where the labelled content is shown, where you can describe the purpose of the label and perhaps provided guidance and contact info for the labels owner.

This is more relevant for some labels than others. chemistry, draft or featured-article labels might all have different meanings to different people and it's important to have a tool by which to explain these things.

One hack implementation we've done is to create a 'labels' space, with a page name there equivalent to each label we want to document. Then we hacked the page LABELS UI to simply dynamically generate an {include:labels:labelname} and also an {include:labels:spacekey labelname} to get the space specific labels. Then we put a link to [labels:spacekey labelname] and [labels:labelname] so people knew where to go to update the info.  All this was displayed on the page you get when you click on [//label/mylabel] or [//label/spacekey/mylabel].

(likewise, i've recommended doing similar embeding of wik content in the UI  for user macros and the notation guide, in other Jira requests).

Thanks
fields.summary: Provide a 'wiki' contents space to describe purpose / ownership of labels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8010].
  {panel}

Prior to 2.7.1, when linking to pages in other spaces, using [key:title] generates exactly that [key:title] text inline. This often does not flow well in natural reading of paragraphs, and when pages are moves from one space to another, sometimes massive numbers of alias that were not originally created need to be updated.

The most common alias for [key:title] is [Title|key:title], which I type 100 times a day.

If we were to leave the space in the text, most commonly it's the 'space name' not the key, that we need rendered.

Recommend:

- Make the default rendering of [key:title] just show "Title". in the default hover text, indicate that it will be linking to a separate space. 
- People can always override this by typing [key:title|key:title] in the rare cases they want to see the key.

- create a configuration item "Show space keys for inter-space links by default". Default to 'true' for backward compatibility.

*note* allegedly, this request was fixed in 2.7.1
fields.summary: Display the Space Name, or at least do not display the space key, by default for key:title links

fields.description:
A few bugs with our current source release:

1. the modules such as "tomcat_env_confluence-webapp" have a dependency to "confluence-webapp", which does not exist (only the confluence module is created)
2. the default.properties file does not get populated correctly (version number, partner name etc)
3. the server.xml for tomcat has the wrong webapp path (because we removed that extra confluence directory)

I have confirmed this for 2.3.2 and 2.4
fields.summary: Fix confluence source release

fields.description:
A common complaint/bugbear I'm hearing from our users is that the David Peterson's TOC macro's generated URLs for headings are way way way too long to put in an email (they're often 3-4 lines long).

This is mostly a symptom of people using long headers (not a bad thing).  David has informed me that his plugin is just using the anchors that Confluence itself is generating, so I'm entering the ticket here.

It would be great if these anchors were shorter, maybe using a hash of the heading instead of the heading itself.  Combining this with a the page's TinyURL would make for nice compact URLs which could be sent out.
fields.summary: Use smaller generated anchor names in generated HTML

fields.description:
Here is a before after scenario when switching from wiki markup to rich text to wiki markup.
The more you switch to wysiwyg keeps repeatedly adding markup.
{noformat}
code: -strikeout-
Before: [-Confluence-|#confluence] 
After:     [|#Confluence,"]-[-Confluence-|#confluence"]-

Before: -[Confluence|#confluence]-
After:     -[-Confluence-|#confluence]- 

Code: color
Before: {color:red}[Confluence|#confluence]{color}
After:     {color:red}[{color:red}Confluence{color}|#confluence]{color}

Before: [{color:red}Confluence{color}|#confluence] 
After:     [Confluence|#confluence">Confluence]

Code: _Italic_
Before: _[Confluence|#confluence]_
After:    _[_Confluence_|#confluence]_

Code: +under+
Before: +[Confluence|#confluence]+
After:     +[+Confluence+|#confluence]+

Code: ^superscript^
Before: ^[Confluence|#confluence]^
After:     ^[^Confluence^|#confluence]^
{noformat}
fields.summary: markup to wysiwyg error on link tag with surrounding wiki markup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7999].
  {panel}

CamelCasing should be able to be turned off for a whole block of text, not just one or two words.  We have thousands of pages of legacy twiki that depend on camelcasing and have been entered into our Confluence system. Consequently we have CamelCasing turned on at global level. However, newer users tend not to like CamelCasing, or are experiencing problems with CamelCase links related to source code postings on wiki pages.

Twiki provided:
<noautolink>
RedHat &
SuSE
</noautolink>

Having this option set on a space by space level would also be very helpful.  http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6526
fields.summary: CamelCase should be a page-level option
Code macro fails to hide brackets

No notifications, no display in "Recently Updated" macros, etc.

fields.description:
If a Confluence XML space export has it's space key modified according to the instructions at http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=14286901 to have an invalid key, the space export will still import without throwing any failure. A check for space key validity should be performed on all exports and the import should fail.

To replicate:
1) Create a space export
2) Modify references to the key according to http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=169578#HowcanIcopyaspace%3F-method2 so that the key is invalid
3) Import the space

The invalid space cannot be deleted or accessed, so this can only be recovered from by reverting to backup or by manually changing the space key to a valid key in the database.
fields.summary: Imports containing invalid space keys should fail

fields.description:
I am unable to get a basic SourceCodeFormatter plugin working, as described here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Code+Formatting+Plugins

I've created a very basic plugin that simply prepends a string to the beginning of a {code:} section. The plugin appears to install correctly after I upload its jar to the Confluence Plugin Manager (in the Administration section of the wiki).

When invoking the plugin with a {code:} section in the wiki, an error occurs. I've attached a tarball containing the plugin jar file that can easily reproduce the problem, and the plugin's source code. I've also attached a screenshot of the Plugin Manager screen (showing it installed correctly), and the attempt to use the {code:} section.

fields.description:
A customer reported:
>
I load a page and click on (view page) to display the page's version history.

I get a new page with the last page version (185) compared to the current page version (186, current). This new page has a link "<< Changes from 184 to 185" ... I click this to see the one level back in the page history.

The new page that loads has version 1 compared to version 185. This is wrong - it should load a page that compares version 184 to version 185.

When clicking on the current page's info tab, and then the View page history link, all the versions are there. I can view any older version from this page and do comparisons.

Has the behavior of view page to see the page history changed? I used to be able to step through each previous version.

Please see the attached screen shots to see the issue.

Screenshot1, current page - click (view change).jpg
Screenshot2, 185 compared to current - click Changes from 184 to 185.jpg
Screenshot3, 1 compared to 185 - WRONG, should be 184 to 185.jpg

fields.description:
'comment added' notifications have links to the space,  the author and two links to the comment.
'comment removed' notifications have links to the space and the remover

Please add a link to the page that the comment was removed from to the 'remove comment' notification, 
Pleaese change the 3rd link on the 'comment added' notification to point to the PAGE, not a second link to the COMMENT.

i.e., for:
================
Comment Added : CONFEXT : Re: Expand Text Macro 
Expand Text Macro has been commented on by David Peterson (Mar 01, 2007). 

Comment:

I'm happy to add it to Composition if the authors are ok with that. Composition is due for some housecleaning also (removing the requirement for composition-setup, faster performance), but that will take longer...

Thanks!

fields.description:
The WYSIWYG Editor breaks a wiki page in a strange way. Not only does the code formatting look different, but also the resulting page.

Create the following text using the wiki editor:

One word {highlight}highlighted{highlight}. Then a new line:\\
One word {strike}with a red strike{strike}.

Have a look at the preview. Then switch to the WYSIWYG editor and the back to preview. You will note that the result looks different.
I have attached two screenshots of the result.

Now swich back to the wiki editor. The code looks now completely different:

One word
{highlight}highlighted
{highlight}. Then a new line:
\\
One word
{strike}with a red strike
{strike}.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG "breaks" pages

fields.description: A regex search and replace across the wiki content of multiple page would have saved me a lot of effort in a couple of cases. Probably only needs two options - a specific space or global.

fields.description: Links on a page in format of [$123456] to an email in the space archive get changed over to the title of the email every time you go into the Rich Text Editor.
fields.summary: Mail linking breaks if the edit mode is toggled to Rich Text Editor mode

fields.description:
When clicking on a thumbnail generated by !imagename.jpg|thumbnail!, the link URL generated is based on the base URL configured. This is not a problem in most cases. However, it is a problem if:

1) The hostname used in the web browser address bar is accessible by the client computer
2) The base URL configured is not

This is especially problematic for SSH users who "tunnel" to the instance of Confluence.

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1) Create a page
2) Attach an image to the page
3) Create a thumbnail in the page using the attached image
4) Configure the base URL to something inreachable
5) View the page
6) Click on the thumbnail
fields.summary: Thumbnail generates link using base URL
Allow emails to be sent to a particular page in Confluence so that they will become the page's attachments

fields.description:
On 2.2.4 Build 704, the Ajax removal of dynamictasklist macro tasks does not remove the task after the user deletes them.

Clicking the 'Del' for a task pops up a confirmation, but after clicking 'OK' the task remains onscreen instead of disappearing immediately. After a page refresh, this task is then gone as expected. It should Ajax disappear as with earlier builds such as 2.2.4 Build 702, which works as expected.
fields.summary: Ajax removal of deleted tasks in dynamic tasklist macro broken - requires page refresh
Heading anchors created with incorrect case
Default search context and exclusions

fields.description: If you have a page with the word 'grants' on it, typing 'grant' in livesearch will bring up the page, but once you complete the word to 'grants' it will disappear. Perhaps the words in the search box aren't being stemmed?
fields.summary: Livesearch macro doesn't find stemmed words
Allow attachment comments to be cleared/removed

fields.description:
When I writing wiki mark up, there are a few tags and combos I use quite a bit (noformat, dynamictasklist).

It would be nice to be able to save a markup snippet (eg. {noformat}{noformat}, and also reuse that snippet from a drop down list just above the Wiki Markup box.

h2. Implementation Thoughts

Just to the left of the Save button, you can have a YUI based drop down menu called "Snippets", which initially has a "Add Selection as Snippet". You'd then select some text in the textarea, go to the menu "Add selection as Snippet", Ajax request is fired, adding the snippet to a list of "Snippets" stored against the user. No sharing allowed.

The snippet would then appear in your menu, presumably with a cross next to it so you can easily delete from the list.

All this *should* be possible, the only real spiking area is whether the select code (http://www.quirksmode.org/js/selected.html) works reasonably reliably
fields.summary: Ability to save Wiki markup snippets

fields.description:
When Confluence is used with Websphere 6.1.0.5 resources such as CSS and Javascript are not loaded correctly resulting in unstyled content and javascript errors.

From Anton on JRA-12039: The problem is that WebSphere 6.1.0.5 checks if a URL is mapped to a servlet or a file before it puts a request through the filter chain.

This means our resource requests totally miss the URL rewriting filter, breaking the loading of JS and CSS resources.
fields.summary: CSS and Javascript not loaded in Websphere 6.1.0.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7952].
  {panel}

Almost all macros would benefit, for example from a parameter called 'context' or 'root' which lets you indicate which page you want the macro to execute from.

{include:root=pagename} (default parameter)
{toc:root=pagename} (not a current parameters, but would be nice)
{metadata-report:root=pagename} (current parameter)

Currently, all macros would have to re-implement this feature, and many do, and often give a different name. If confluence provided a $rootcontext variable to the macros, which was loaded from a standard 'root' or 'context' parameter, it would enforce standardization.

Other candidates for standardized 'global' parameters can be found on a page in the confluence extensions section, written by either Guy Fraser or David Peterson, but I couldn't find it right now. I'll list a few here:

pages - takes a well-written query language that allows macros to simply recieve a list of pages on which to perform their action (such as a $pages collection), but without each macro having to re-invent or re-implement a (different) query language. It could take:
- list of specific pages, or space:pages, with a standard delimiter ( ; ? )
- wildcards or regular expressions to indicate a group of pages by name
- perhaps keywords or symbols like @children, @parent of the current page
- space key designations
- as the 'parser' changes or becomes more sophisticated, existing macros woudl all benefit from these changes because they simply use the $pages collection.

labels - same as above: sets $pages to a set of pages that satify a 'label query', with () for nesting and some operators for and/or/not ( + , ! )

scope - descendents, ancestors, space, site, children, parent, self - specifies dynamic scope relative to the 'pages' option, or might be incorporated in the pages query language

query - uses the built in query language, i.e "title:My Page* AND author:james") to retrieve a set of pages for the macro's operation

style - specify a direct CSS style for this tag. These could then, in theory, be filterd by a per site configuration for all macros
css - specify a css class. likewise, could then be manipulated / translate site-wide for all macros

output - wiki / table / html / text (specified how output sould be rendered in page context after macro returns results)
input - wiki / table / html / text (specified how input should be rendered before passed to $body for macro plugin)

There are no doubt others that could be used. This request is for Atlassian to put in place the framework to support these 'global macro parameters'.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Create a set of useful global macro parameters which macro developers can use without re-inventing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7950].
  {panel}

It would be nice to be able to send somebody a link taking them to the "view difference" pages for two specific versions of a file (like the output of diffpagesbyversion.action).

Example scenario: 

A page is being used to track project status. There is a weekly review meeting to discuss the project.
The ability to send link showing diffs between the page after the last review meeting compared with the current status would be useful. 
Note that last meeting may not be the previous version in Confluence since other changes may have been made between meetings.

Doesn't need to be pretty - something like http://wiki.wiki.com/pages/diffpagesbyversion.action?pageId=9992&v1=1234&v2=5678 would do.

Would be nice to have a specific code for the "current" version. For example - http://wiki.wiki.com/pages/diffpagesbyversion.action?pageId=9992&v1=1234&v2=current
fields.summary: Add ability to link to differences between specific page versions

fields.description: From default, customizing the layout can be saved.  Once modified, the save function appears to work but does not. Workaround is to copy the change, reset to default and re-customize.  Save then works.
fields.summary: Save doesn't work editing the Main Layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7948].
  {panel}

Allow an anchor to be specified when linking to a Confluence attachment.

For instance if I have a PDF called MyDocument.pdf and I want to link directly to page 4 I should be able to link to it thusly:

[Page 4 of My Document|MySpace^MyDocument.pdf#page=4]

PDF readers process URL anchors to jump straight to the desired page.
fields.summary: Allow the specification of an anchor when linking to attachments

fields.description:
CSP-6910 suggests that the export created a user from each repository causing a conflict when importing.

A priority should be given to each repository or users should be merged so that duplicates aren't created when exported.
fields.summary: Export creates user from each user repository

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7945].
  {panel}

Users appear to be manually adding anonymous comment spam to public Confluence instances such as http://confluence.atlassian.com

If captcha is bypassed, it would be useful to allow logged-in users the option of flagging comments or pages as spam. 

At the bottom of each page should be a 'Report Spam' option for logged-in users only. Clicking this link adds the label 'spam' to the page. If the page already has the label 'spam', the link should read 'Remove Spam Flag'

Administrators can then monitor an RSS feed or watch for pages marked as spam.
fields.summary: Add 'Report Spam' Option For Logged In Users

fields.description:

fields.description:
After a clean install we try to import a full backup from 2.1.5a, we have always used this upgrade method as it allows us to have the old instance on standby if having to downgrade. Did an upgrade to 2.2.10 a couple of months ago, but that failed due to other stability related bugs in that Confluence version. 

Upload and unpacking is OK, but after 22% completion the import stops with the following error message: 
Import failed. (HibernateTemplate): data integrity violated by SQL ''; nested exception is java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Duplicate entry '18226' for key 1

There's a lot of SQL related errors in the logs, attaching log from run with Jrockit and Mysql. Tried using different JVMs, different backup files and both MySQL and Postgresql, same problem on all tried combinations.
fields.summary: Import full backup from 2.1.5a fails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* [Adobe provides the ability to link to a specific page in PDF.|https://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/link-html-pdf-page-acrobat.html]
* However, when appending the {{#page=#}} as recommended by Adobe, it only links to the PDF itself, and not the specified page.
* {color:#205081}Example{color} suggested URL: http://CONFLUENCE-INSTANCE-URL/pages/worddav/preview.action?fileName=File-Name.pdf&pageId=000000#page=3

h3. Suggested Solution
* Permit a way for a user to select a specific page in PDF and link to it, such as with the *Insert Link* option in the editor.
* Here, you can select an attachment for linking. Something could be added when you select a PDF document where you can also specify a page from here.

h3. Why this is important
It's a built-in feature that Adobe has so we can take advantange of this and program it into Confluence for better ease of use.
fields.summary: Provide users ability to link to a specific page in PDF attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7940].
  {panel}

The Confluence "Standard Installation" uses the Embedded HSQL database.  When doing a Custom Installation the user is told that HSQL should not be used in production instances.  

The implication is that a "Standard Installation" is in fact a "non-production Installation".  

Wouldn't "Demonstration Installation" or "Test Installation" or "Dodgy, Non Production, Easy Express Installation" be better terms?

That way people wouldn't keep asking: "Why did nobody tell us that HSQL wasn't for production instances?"
fields.summary: Standard Installation not really standard

fields.description:
This is fairly complicated to repro:
1. create pages A, B, and C in the same space.
2. make B the child of A, C a sibling of A.
3. put in A: {children:all=true|excerpt=true}
4. put in B: {excerpt} Here is an excerpt that contains a link to [C]. {excerpt}
5. go to A and verify to that it shows the correct thing ("B -- Here is an excert that contains a link to C.")
5. Now... change the name of "C" to "D".
6. Go back to A. You'll see that B's excerpt is gone! It should be there!
7. Go to B. Click Edit, then Save. (Don't change anything.)
8. Go back to A. Voila, B's excerpt is back!

I use {children:all=true|excerpt=true} quite a bit, so this problem really bogs me down.
fields.summary: Indirectly changing a link inside of an excerpt causes {children:all=true|excerpt=true} to drop the excerpt.
Make VersionHistorySummary.versionComment available via XML-RPC

fields.description:
The content-by-label macro is not correctly finding pages with the desired label.  
Example: We have a page which includes the {contentbylabel:twg-submitted} macro instantiation.
There is a page with this label in the same space which is not being seen.  We have attempted to move the page to a different parent, move it to a different space, and even performing a full re-indexing of the entire wiki, without luck.  The page simply does not appear in the list generated by the macro.  Three separate people have double checked that the spellings were correct...yet the macro is still broken.

This is a critical bug for our organization, as we intend to write several plugins to better organize our wiki based on page labeling.  However, if we cannot assume that pages will be correctly found when searching by labels, the plugins are effectively useless.
fields.summary: content-by-label macro is missing pages

fields.description:
I'd like to see added control over placing paragraphs within a list structure using wiki markup, or at least a tag to say logically group these elements. There needs to be a way to do the following without using HTML just using wiki markup, currently when you do this in markup: # foo ## bar ## baz this is an introduction to my next list item # bay It renders in my opinion inefficiently the logical grouping should be like this:
  1. foo
    1. bar
    2. baz

    this is an introduction to my next list item

  2. bob
So the introduction to the next item indents to the sublist instead of the main list in the first example and I'd like to indent to the main list instead. There needs to be a way to tell Confluence where to put the paragraph.
fields.summary: I'd like to see added control over placing paragraphs within a list structure using wiki markup.

fields.description:

{jiraportlet:url=http://jira.objectware.no/jira/secure/RunPortlet.jspa?portletKey=com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:createdvsresolved&cumulative=true&daysprevious=30&periodName=daily&projectOrFilterId=filter-10559&versionLabels=major&os_username=XXX&os_password=XXX} {jiraportlet:url=http://jira.objectware.no/jira/secure/RunPortlet.jspa?portletKey=com.laughingpanda.jira:versionWorkloadChart&chart.height=300&chart.width=500&startDate=2006-01-01&versionId=10418&os_username=XXX&os_password=XXX}

fields.summary: Using the JIRAPORTLET macro does not render any HTML at all

fields.description:
After we upgraded to 2.3.3 from 2.1.5a, we started to get errrors such as below. A user informed us about the errors just after we had upgraded. He was updating, changing contents, pages. However, He was unable to see modifications, and worse, he lost the contents of the pages. And such complaints increased . We are able to see the page  (overall), however, we are not able to see the contents of the pages and we have completely lost the date related to page updates, etc. 

We, then,  took a deeper look at the database to see whether we have got an index problem or not - since indexing problems can be solved easly with doing a re-index using administration page - , we saw that data are lost at the db either.

Attached is the atlassian-confluence.log.

Sincreley.
fields.summary: We have lost the contents of the pages after confluence upgrade from 2.1.5a to 2.3.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7917].
  {panel}

Different databases have different settings for case sensitivity. The case sensitivity of the database is usually set through the collation that it uses. 

The default embedded database (HSQL) in Confluence is a CASE SENSITIVE database. When you attempt to migrate this data to an external database that is set up with a case insensitive collation, you may experience problems. 

You may encounter this error for example: 

The data import process reported the duplicate error on the wrong object:
 Import failed. (HibernateTemplate): data integrity violated by SQL ''; nested exception is java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Duplicate entry 'OSUser_user-11-confluence.prefs.email.notify' for key 1 

or 

2007-02-21 15:02:03,676 ERROR [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint 'PK__OS_PROPERTYENTRY__619B8048'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'OS_PROPERTYENTRY'.
2007-02-21 15:02:03,692 ERROR [confluence.importexport.impl.ReverseDatabinder] endElement net.sf.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not insert: [bucket.user.propertyset.BucketPropertySetItem#bucket.user.propertyset.BucketPropertySetItem@d88630dc]
net.sf.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not insert: [bucket.user.propertyset.BucketPropertySetItem#bucket.user.propertyset.BucketPropertySetItem@d88630dc]
	at net.sf.hibernate.exception.SQLStateConverter.convert(SQLStateConverter.java:62)
	at net.sf.hibernate.exception.JDBCExceptionHelper.convert(JDBCExceptionHelper.java:29)
fields.summary: Support migration from a case-sensitive database (including HSQL) to a case-insensitive database
